alert.note: Alert for Caledonia; Orange; Washington (Vermont) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Burlington (Northern Vermont and New York)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 16 at 3:21PM EDT by NWS Burlington
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Orange, southwestern Caledonia and northeastern Washington Counties through 345 PM EDT... At 321 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Orange, moving north at 25 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Barre, Calais, Plainfield, Orange, Websterville, East Montpelier, Corinth, Marshfield Village, Topsham, Groton, Marshfield, Cabot Village, Barre Town, Topsham Four Corners, Washington, Cabot, Groton Village, Ricker State Park, Peacham and Barre City. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 800 PM EDT for central and northeastern Vermont.
